eu_initiatives:
Wales Arts International and the Arts Council of Wales have responded in the past to consultations about future funding programmes (this was prior to the 2014-2020 programmes, so not current). 
 
We follow current initiatives around culture at EU level.   
 
We have engaged in submitting evidence at member state and regional level to inquiries into the impact of Brexit on the cultural sector.
section: VI - Organisations representing local, regional and municipal authorities, other public or mixed entities, etc.
subsection: Other public or mixed entities, created by law whose purpose is to act in the public interest
membership:
1. On the Move www.on-the-move.org  
2. IETM www.ietm.org  
3. Culture Action Europe www.cultureactioneurope.org 
4. Res Artis www.resartis.org
relevant_communication: The Head of Wales Arts International, Eluned Haf, has been invited to present at the forthcoming public hearing in the European Parliament's Culture and Education Committee, on the implications of Brexit on culture and education, 21 June 2017.
legal_status: Welsh Government Sponsored Body and independent charity
goals__remit: The Arts Council of Wales is the official public body responsible for funding and developing the arts in Wales. We are accountable to the National Assembly for Wales and responsible to the Welsh Government for the way the money they provide to fund the arts in Wales is spent. We are also a Lottery distributor for the arts in Wales. Wales Arts International is the international arm of the Arts Council of Wales.
